fields.System.Title: TX-02.1 Receive from CRA - Death Match data
fields.System.Description:
As a system, I want to be able to receive deceased beneficiary data from CRA, so that I can update client's records with the date of death.

Background

On an annual basis, CRA sends to Service Canada a data file identifying deceased beneficiaries for CPP clients and OAS clients.  Database is then updated with the date of death.

Frequency
Annually

Complexity


External Dependencies


Data

No data available from UC


Testing Details

Post events

  • Suspend an Account - If a client has been recorded as a Non-Filer in the yearly file AND the client does not live in a country that is identified as “tax-recovery-exempt”, an event must be created to advise Adjudication System to suspend the client’s OAS Pension as of June 30th.

 

  • Non-Filer Correspondence – If an account has been identified as a Non-Filer in the yearly file from CRA (and the client does not live in a country that is identified as “tax-recovery-exempt”, an event needs to be created to advise Benefit Management System to produce the ISP3058 (Notice of Suspension for Non-Resident Non-Filers).
fields.Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
1. GIVEN that the System receives from CRA Client's date of death data     

WHEN  there's a client's match between CRA client AND OAS Beneficiary

THEN the system process the data as required
fields.Custom.Assumptions:
1. OAS clients will include OAS clients administered by International Operations.
  2. There's a mechanism to let the recipient know that data is ready for processing

fields.System.Title: 517-TX-02.2a-02 Send to CRA - OAS Recovery Tax Request Request for New Business (New Client) Data
fields.System.Description:
Description:
As a system, I want to be able to send a list of new OAS accounts in pay to CRA, so that CRA can determine and return the OAS Recovery Tax amounts to me.

Background

Process Description:
Service Canada sends CRA a file containing a list of new accounts in pay during the month so that CRA can determine the OAS Recovery Tax for the new clients.  CRA then sends a return file with OAS Tax Recovery amount to be applied against the client's payment

Frequency:
Monthly, part of the month-end run

Complexity:

External Dependencies:

Data:

Field

Description

Social Insurance Number (SIN)

  • All records must contain a SIN. If the client does not have a SIN, the client should not be selected for the file.

Administrating Region Code

  • This is the OAS region code.

Country Code

  • This is the country related to the client’s address.

Surname Tag

  • This is the first 5 characters of the client’s surname. The source should be ITR however, if ITR is not present, select the OAS source.

Full Name

  • This is the client’s complete name (including title: Mr. Mrs. Ms. etc.). The source of the client’s name is to be ITR unless it is not present otherwise, select the OAS source name.

Home Address

  • This is the client’s home address. If there is an ITR address, the ITR home address must be selected however, if there is no ITR home address, the OAS home address must be selected.

Postal Code

  • This is the postal code related to the address in the above field.

Language Code

  • This is the written language of business (English or French only).

Date of Birth

  • This is the OAS source Date of Birth (if there is an ITR source created for DOB, then the DOB with the source ITR should be selected).

Assigned Account Number

  • This value must equal the SIN.

Testing Details
fields.Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
Precondition: Requests have been generated and added to the CRA outbound request log from any source
Trigger: Scheduler
Frequency: Monthly

-----------------------

1. Given that the New OAS/IA Business Account record has been generated 
    When the timing of the scheduled event has been met,       
    Then the system will send the data to CRA (ex. via FTP).

2. Given that the New OAS/IA Business Account record has been generated
    When the the New OAS/IA Business Account record is sent successfully
    Then the status of the New OAS/IA Business Account record will be updated to "Sent", and the date and timestamp will be recorded

3. Given that the New OAS/IA Business Account record has been sent to the CRA
    When the the New OAS/IA Business Account record is sent successfully 
    Then the status of the active OAS Recovery Tax request log is updated to "sent"

4. Given that the New OAS/IA Business Account record has not been sent to the CRA successfully
    When an acknowledgement from CRA has not been received
    Then the solution will follow the standard Interop error handling
fields.Custom.Assumptions:
The system is up and running and is not experiencing scheduled or unscheduled downtime (see ALT1)
  • the Connectivity with AB is up and running (see ALT2)
  • Client has a SIN
  • Data is sent in a secure and encrypted process
  • There's a mechanism to let the recipient knows that data is ready for processing
Design Considerations: 
  • CRA only works based on SIN's. Therefore any OAS applicants who do not have a SIN can still apply, but CRA will not return any client information in this two way process.
  • ALT1: What is the process around schedule or unscheduled downtime?
  • ALT2: What shall the system do if the connectivity with CRA is lacking?
fields.System.Tags: OAS Specific; Pod 5 - Interfaces; reference; Tax Exchange

fields.System.Title: 517-TX-02.2b-01 Receive from CRA - Recovery Tax for New Business (New Client) Response Data
fields.System.Description:
Description:
As a system, I want to be able to receive client OAS Recovery tax amounts from CRA, so that the tax recovery amounts can be applied to the applicable client payments.

Process Description:
Service Canada sends CRA a file containing a list of new accounts in pay during the month so that CRA can determine the OAS Recovery Tax for the new clients.  CRA then sends a return file with OAS Tax Recovery amount to be applied against the client's payment

For this monthly process (sending new business accounts to CRA, and receiving new business response file from CRA), CRA will provide a list of only those clients that are subject to OAS Recovery Tax (clients from the original request file are not listed if they are not subject to OAS Recovery Tax).

Frequency:
Monthly, part of the month-end run

Complexity:
N/A

External Dependencies
N/A

Data:
see attachment

Testing Details:
N/A

Post Events:
OAS Recovery Tax Correspondence – for all accounts that have been identified in the weekly or monthly process with a new or changed OAS Recovery Tax amount, an event needs to be created to advise the Benefit Management System to produce the ISP3086 (Domestic OAS Recovery Tax Letter (OAS & IA)) or the  ISP3087 (Foreign OAS Recovery Tax Letter (OAS & IA)). Refer to activity ITR-ICE-2012-04688 – OAS Recovery Tax Correspondence.
fields.Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
Precondition(s): The initial request has been successfully sent and received by CRA
Trigger(s): File transfer received from CRA. 
Frequency: Monthly, part of the month-end run.

----------------------------------

Refer to #7681 

1. Given that the CRA file "OAS Recovery Tax for New Business via 2 Way Process" has been sent to the CRA and an acknowledgement from CRA has been received,
    When the response file is received from CRA,
    Then the initial "OAS  Recovery Tax for New Business" log will be updated with the appropriate client information and status for each entry based on the response file

2. Given that CRA "OAS Recovery Tax for New Business via 2 Way Process" file exists in the system, 
    When the CRA response file is not received from CRA within one week (see design considerations),
    Then the solution will follow the standard Interop error handling on interface availability during non-blackout periods. 
  • Action item is out to see if the above really applies. A response may not be required meaning AC4 isn't needed.
fields.Custom.Assumptions:
• All data elements are present and in the required format
  • The system is up and running and is not experiencing scheduled or unscheduled downtime (see ALT1)
  • the Connectivity with AB is up and running (see ALT2)
  • Client has a SIN
  • TX-02.2a process is completed
  • Data is sent in a secure and encrypted process
  • OAS clients will include OAS clients administered by International Operations.
  • There's a mechanism to let the recipient knows that data is ready for processing
Design Considerations:
  • ALT1: What is the process around schedule or unscheduled downtime?
  • ALT2: What shall the system do if the connectivity with CRA is lacking?
fields.System.Tags: OAS Specific; Pod 5 - Interfaces; reference; Tax Exchange

fields.System.Title: 518-TX-02.4-02 Send to CRA - Non-Resident Client Extract data
fields.System.Description:
Description:
As a system, I want to be able to send information on active OAS beneficiary accounts that have a foreign residential address to CRA, so that they can update their records accordingly.

Background

Process Description:
An annual report will be sent to the Canada Revenue Agency (CRA) detailing any OAS beneficiary that is in pay and has a foreign home address at the time the extract report is pulled. Mid-year changes in residency are not reflected in this report. (CRA would have record of these changes based on foreign tax remittance from clients mid-year.) 

Frequency:
Yearly, following December month-end

Complexity


External Dependencies:
Data migration of foreign country codes (format)
"ACTIVE ACCOUNTS WITH COUNTRY CODE 061 ARE ADDITIONALLY WRITTEN TO A SEPARATE FILE, WHICH DOES NOT GET SENT TO CRA"

Data:
Application Code;
SIN;
Admin Region Code;
Country Code;
Surname tag;
Name;
Home address line 1;
Home address line 2;
Home address line 3;
Home address line 4;
Home address postal code;
Language code;
Date of Birth;
Account Number


Position                Field                                        Picture             Content/Comment

001 - 001               Application code                        X                      “O”  for OAS

002 - 010               SIN                                              9(9)

011 - 012               Admin Region code                   9(02)

013 - 015               Country code                            XXX 

016 - 016               Filler                                         X

017 - 021               Surname tag                             X(5)

022 - 026               Filler                                         X(5)

027 - 068               Name                                       X(42)

069 - 098               Home address line 1                 X(30)

099 - 128               Home address line 2                 X(30)

129 - 158               Home address line 3                 X(30)

159 - 174               Home address line 4                 X(16)

175 - 180               Home address postal code        X(6)

181 - 188               Filler                                         X(8)

189 - 189               Language code                         X (1)

190 - 193               Filler                                         X(4)

194 - 197               Date of Birth                             9(4)

198 - 206               Account number                        X(9)

207 - 210               Filler                                         X(4)


Testing Details
fields.Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
Precondition: The system is able to send the data
Triggers: Scheduler - following December Month-end
Frequency: Yearly

-------------------

1. Given that a new "CRA Non-Resident Client Extract Data" request log has been generated 
    When the scheduler triggers the sending of the CRA Non-Resident Client Extract Data to CRA
    Then the system will prepare the data package to be sent to the CRA by querying newly generated and populated "CRA Non-Resident Client Data" log for entries, record the date & timestamp that is associated with each entry, and set the status as 'Requested'

2. Given that the CRA File "CRA Non-Resident Client Data 1-way" has been sent to the CRA,
    When the CRA File "CRA Non-Resident Client Data 1-way" is sent successfully,
    Then the status of the CRA File "CRA Non-Resident Client Data 1-way" will be updated to "Sent", and the date and timestamp will be recorded.

3. Given that the CRA File "CRA Non-Resident Client Data 1-way" has been sent to the CRA,
    When the CRA File "CRA Non-Resident Client Data 1-way" is sent successfully,
    Then the status of the active "CRA Non-Resident Client Extract Data" request log is updated to "sent".

4. Given that the CRA File "CRA Non-Resident Client Data 1-way" has not been sent to the CRA successfully,
    When an acknowledgement from CRA has not been received,
    Then the solution will follow the standard Interop error handling.
fields.Custom.Assumptions:
• Residential address must be captured for the client to be able to send the proper information to CRA
  • This extract is based on a snapshot of data at year-end and does not consider mid-year changes. If a client's active residential address changed to/from a foreign residential address through the year, CRA would already have record of clients who have moved to/from foreign country mid-year based on remittance of foreign tax.

fields.System.Title: 518-TX-02.5-01 Receive from CRA - Non-Resident Non-Filer (OASRI) OAS Accounts data
fields.System.Description:
Description:
As a system, I want to be able to receive from CRA all Non-Resident Non-Filer accounts, so that I can suspend the respective client accounts from receiving a benefit until the clients have filed their income tax.

Background

Process Description:
CRA sends ESDC an annual file containing all foreign Non-Resident accounts that have not returned the required non-resident OASRI form to CRA. ESDC suspends the Non-Filer accounts from receiving the OAS benefit.

Frequency:
Yearly (after tax slip season, around Summer time)

Complexity:


External Dependencies:


Data:
See Attachment


Testing Details:
fields.Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
Precondition(s): 
Frequency: Scheduler
Trigger(s): Yearly (after tax slip season, around Summer time)

---------------     

Refer to #7681 

1. Given that the timing of the scheduled event has been met,     
    When the CRA NR OASRI Non-Filer Account Record is received, 
    Then file will be stored in the infrastructure folder where Curam batch will pick up and store in Curam tables.

2. Given that the timing of the scheduled event has been met,
    When the CRA NR OASRI Non-Filer Account Record is not received from CRA within one week,
    Then the solution will follow the standard Interop error handling on interface availability during non-blackout periods.
fields.Custom.Assumptions:
• All date elements are present and in the required format
  • The system is up and running and is not experiencing scheduled or unscheduled downtime
  • the Connectivity is up and running
  • Data is sent in a secure and encrypted process
  • There's a mechanism to let the recipient knows that data is ready for processing

Design Consideration:
  • Define duration after which error handling solution will begin after data has not been received
  • Should there be a notification if/when file received
  • Archiving and retention

fields.System.Title: 518-TX-02.6-01 Receive from CRA - Non-Resident Tax Reduction (NR5) data
fields.System.Description:
Description:
As a system, I want to be able to receive from CRA the NR5 Tax Reduction data, so that the records of affected clients can be updated with the approved reduced rate and the Non-Resident Tax Withhold amount can be calculated. 

As the system, I want to receive from CRA a list of the approved reductions on withheld tax annually, so that the records of affected clients can be updated with the approved reduced rate and the Non-Resident Tax Withhold amount can be calculated.

Background

Process Description:
CRA sends ESDC a file of foreign residents who have requested and been approved (by CRA) for a reduction in their Non Resident Tax rate. When the NR5 Elections file is received, the system will update the beneficiary’s account with the approved reduced rate in order to calculate the Non Resident Tax Withhold amount. The rate, rate reason, and end date will be updated, as per the information in the file. 
Note: As of January 2011, CRA has allowed non-residents to file one NR5 application for every five taxation years (as opposed to every year) and to retain their approved reduced rate throughout the five years. 

Frequency:
Weekly (but it can be sent more frequently during periods of high volume)

Complexity:


External Dependencies:


Data:
see attachment

Testing Details:
fields.Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
Precondition(s): 
Frequency: Weekly (but it can be sent more frequently during periods of high volume) Definition of high volume
Trigger(s): 

---------------     

Refer to #7681 

1. When the CRA NR5 Tax Reduction File is received, 
    Then file will be stored in the infrastructure folder where Curam batch will pick up and store in Curam tables.

2. Given that the timing of the scheduled event has been met,
    When the CRA NR5 Tax Reduction File is not received from CRA within one week,
    Then the solution will follow the standard Interop error handling on interface availability during non-blackout periods.
fields.Custom.Assumptions:
• All data elements are present and in the required format
  • The system is up and running and is not experiencing scheduled or unscheduled downtime
  • the Connectivity with CRA is up and running
  • OAS clients will include OAS clients administered by International Operations.
  • Data is sent in a secure and encrypted process
  • There are linkages to other user stories after the load of this data (i.e. Reports)
Design Consideration:
  • Define duration after which error handling solution will begin after data has not been received
  • Should there be a notification if/when file received
  • Archiving and retention

fields.System.Title: TX-01.13a1 Send to CRA - NR4 Tax Slips
fields.System.Description:
As a system, I want to issue the NR4 tax slip data so that I can send it to CRA and CRA can process it

Background

Tax slip information is sent to CRA for all individuals, including deceased recipients, who had monies paid, monies recovered and/or taxes withheld from OAS benefits.  System created original tax slip information is sent annually. Manual and amended tax slip information, as well as information pertaining to tax slips which have been cancelled, is sent weekly. (via different interface). Manual Tax slips that are created to close out a deceased recipients account will not be sent to CRA until the year end process.  Notional Tax information is sent to CRA for all CPP tax slips annually for all orginal tax slips and is sent weekly for any amended or manual tax slip where the retroactive benefit of $300 or more for previous years.  CRA does not require Notional Tax information for OAS accounts.

Note: Current process involves converting data files to XML data files. Design will need to consider whether XML is still the correct output format for the partner.

The information on the T4a file generation and where the file is downloaded etc is describe in Foundation.  Should the Foundation feature also be the base of the NR4?  
Automatic - separate feed (not the same feed) - New tax slip for a client after a tax slip has been cancelled
Gather requirements from Lynn based on CPP
Frequency
Annually (January)

Complexity


External Dependencies

Data

1.1.1.1        Type

This is the type of tax slip (NR4)

1.1.1.2        Taxation Year

Format: YYYY; Box 10 on the NR4 (OAS)

This is the taxation year associated with the tax slip information.

1.1.1.3        Category

Ex: Original, Duplicate, etc

This is the category of the tax slip information.

1.1.1.4        Language

Valid value: English, Français

This is the language of preference of the client.

1.1.1.5        Current Name

Format: Surname Given Name

1.1.1.6        Current Address

Format: 40 characters per line (excluding spaces); 4 lines maximum

This is the current beneficiary/contact address. The system will determine which address to use when compiling the tax slip information.

1.1.1.7        Region Code (OCON)

Format: 00 (0000)

This is the processing office associated with the tax slip information.

1.1.1.8        Language Preference Identifier

Valid values: E, F, Blank

This is the language of choice of the client. If blank (no language identified) the client’s postal code will determine the language used for inserts.

1.1.1.9        Social Insurance Number

Format:  999999999; Box 12 on the T4A (OAS)

This is the Social Insurance Number. If the Social Insurance Number is not available, the field is to the OAS account number (Box 13 on the T4A (OAS)), if this field is not available it should be 000000000.
N.B. If the beneficiary does not have a Social Insurance Number the system will compile tax slip information using the beneficiary’s OAS Account Number and/or Client Identifier


1.1.1.10     Taxable Pension Paid

Format: $999,999,999.99 Box 18 on the T4A (OAS)

This is the amount of taxable OAS pension paid.

1.1.1.11     Gross Pension Paid

Format: $999,999,999.99 Box 19 on the T4A (OAS)

This is the total amount of taxable and non-taxable OAS benefits paid.

1.1.1.12     Overpayment recovered

Format: $999,999,999.99 Box 20 on the T4A (OAS)

This is the amount recovered from an overpayment of benefits. This amount is deducted from the gross pension paid.

1.1.1.13     Net Supplements Paid

Format: $999,999,999.99 Box 21 on the T4A (OAS)

This is the amount of income tested, non-taxable OAS benefits paid. The net amount of any allowance, allowance for the survivor, or guaranteed income supplement you received in the year.

1.1.1.14     Income Tax Deducted

Format: $999,999,999.99 Box 22 on the T4A (OAS)

This is the amount of income tax deducted from taxable OAS benefits paid.

1.1.1.15     Quebec Income Tax Deducted

Format: $999,999,999.99 Box 23 on the T4A (OAS)

This is the amount of income tax deducted from taxable OAS benefits paid for Quebec residents.

1.1.1.16     Recipient Code

Valid values: 1 (Individual), 4 (POA or Trustee); Box 11 on the NR4 (OAS)

1.1.1.17     Country Code

Format: XXX; Box 12 on the NR4 (OAS)

This code represents the foreign country of residence during which payments were made to the client.  Note: there may be multiple NR4 (OAS) slips dependent on the number of countries the client lived throughout the taxation year.

1.1.1.18     Old Age Security Number

1.1.1.19     Non-resident Account Number

1.1.1.20     Foreign or Canadian tax identification number

Valid value: Payee’s SIN, OAS Account Number or 000000000;
Box 13 on the NR4 (OAS)

This field is to be populated by the payee’s SIN and if no SIN is available, record all zeroes in this field.

1.1.1.21     Income Code

Valid values: 44 (OAS) or 45 Net Federal Supplements (GIS, ALW or ALWS)

This field represents the type of income reported on the NR4 (OAS) tax slip Line 1.

Line 2 is when OAS Recovery Tax is to be reported.

1.1.1.22     Currency Code

Valid value: CAD (Canadian Dollar); Box 15 and 25 on the NR4 (OAS)

This field represents the currency of the benefits paid and will always be Canadian dollars.

1.1.1.23     Gross Income

Format: $999,999,999.99 Box 16 on the NR4 (OAS)

This is the old age security pension amount.

1.1.1.24     Non-Resident Tax Withheld

Format: $999,999,999.99; Box 17 and 27 on the NR4 (OAS)

This is the amount of non-resident tax deducted.

1.1.1.25     Exemption Code

Valid values: Blank, T and J; Box 18 and 28 on the NR4 (OAS)

This field reflects the beneficiary’s non-resident tax rate. Blank should be 25%, T should be < 25% (as a result of a Tax Treaty); J should be< 25% (as a result of NR5 reduction is present approval from CRA).

1.1.1.26     Recovery Tax Withheld

Format: $999,999,999.99; Box 27 on the NR4 (OAS)

This field represents the amount of OAS recovery tax withheld from the client due to gross income levels being above threshold.

 

1.1.1.27     Non-resident account number

Valid values: NRF333146

This field is associated with the NR4 (OAS).

1.1.1.28     Name and address of payer or agent

Valid value: “SERVICE CANADA” and “OLD AGE SECURITY”
Valid value: “SERVICE CANADA” and “SÉCURITÉ DE LA VIEILLESSE”

This field is to be displayed on two lines on the NR4 (OAS)

1.1.1.29     Date for Credit Slip

Format: MMM YYYY

This is the date of issue of the Credit Slip. e.g. Jan 2013 for the annual tax slip processing job.

1.1.1.30     Receipt Number

Format: blank

This field is to be left blank for all Credit Slip.

1.1.1.31     Amount

Format: $999,999,999.99; Box B on the Credit Slip

This is the amount in excess of benefits entitlement for the taxation year (this amount will never be negative).

1.1.1.32     Benefit Number

Format: 999999999999; Box D on the Credit Slip; can also be found on the T4A(OAS).

1.1.1.33     “The net amount you may claim when filing your federal tax return is”

Format: $999,999,999.99

This is the net amount of the Credit Slip.


Testing Details


Post events

The system will compile and store the NR4 (OAS) information for each Taxation Year.

The system will populate the tax slip details display with the results of taxable income calculations and any changes to the Year to date ( YTD) information.

Original tax slip information, which has been stored in the system, will be sent to CRA annually and will be identified with the Category “Original” 


Why is the title of this one "Create", but not the T4a?
fields.Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
1. GIVEN that client's calculated taxable income is a positive amount   

WHEN the client lives outside of Canada at the time of  those payments

THEN  the client is  part of the selection  


2. GIVEN that the previous criterion was met    

WHEN tax slip information has a Category other than “Original” and "Duplicate" 

THEN the system compiles tax slip information type NR4


3. GIVEN that the system was able to compile all the tax slip information needed   

WHEN the timming for sending the data is reached

THEN  the system sends Client's information to CRA


4. GIVEN that client's calculated taxable income is zero AND there is no Non-Resident Tax amount greater than zero   

WHEN the client lives outside of Canada at the time of  those payments

THEN  the system doesn't compile tax slip information type NR4

  

N.B. The system will compile and store annual original tax slip information for monies paid, monies recovered and/or taxes withheld for an entire Calendar Year January 1st to December 31st. For cash receipt, cancelled payment, priority payment – the calendar date is used. For anything related to payment/recovered payment and tax slips – the payment due date is used

N.B.B.  Previously sent tax slip information with the Category “Original” and "Duplicate" will not be sent again.  
Where any recovery for the same benefit is applied to a client’s account that has a Departmental Receivable actioned for the same benefit, the Year-To-Date Totals and Taxable Income reflects the changes accordingly.

Estate Manual tax slips issued in the current year will be included in the annual file to CRA

fields.System.Title: TX-03.7a2 Receive from CRA - Client Tax Filing Data (OAS Auto Enroll, Cat 2)
fields.System.Description:
As a system, I want to be able to receive from CRA tax filing data for individuals who are not in receipt of a CPP or RRQ benefit, but who have 40 years of participation at CPP and/or RRQ, so that I can auto-enroll clients to OAS.

Background

On a monthly basis, there is a process that will automatically identify and enrol eligible individuals (who are not in receipt of a CPP or RRQ benefit) for the OAS pension (Category 2).

Design Consideration: Before the CRA will send this information to the system, the request must be sent to CRA with a list of eligible client information for OAS Category 2 auto-enrolment. This request is a design consideration around ITRDS as to whether ITRDS will send the request on behalf of OAS and OAS will receive the response. This design must be considered in relation to the ITRDS interfaces (#7528).

Frequency
Monthly

Complexity


External Dependencies


Data

No data available from UC


Testing Details

Post events

  • the total number of clients who meet the criteria must be counted for monthly reporting purposes.  These are the total number of clients that will be considered for enrolment under both Category 1 or Category 2
fields.Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
1. GIVEN that the timing of the schedule event has been met      

WHEN  the system receives  from CRA  tax filing data for individuals who have 40 years of participation at CPP and/or RRQ AND  who are not in receipt of a CPP or RRQ benefit

THEN The system is able to store the information to determine whether the client will be Auto-enrolled for OAS benefit
fields.Custom.Assumptions:
• CRA has received the request to provide information to ESDC
  • All data elements are present and in the required format
  • The system is up and running and is not experiencing scheduled or unscheduled downtime
  • the Connectivity with CRA is up and running 
  • Data is sent in a secure and encrypted process

fields.System.Title: TX-03.7b Receive from CRA - Client Income and Marital Status (GIS Auto Enroll, Cat 3)
fields.System.Description:
As a system, I want to be able to receive from CRA client (and spousal, where applicable) data, including marital status and income, so that I can auto-enroll clients to the Guaranteed Income Supplement (GIS) benefit.
(CAT3)

Background

The OAS/GIS Automatic Enrolment Notification letter is produced at age 64 when the clients are selected for Category 1 and Category 2 OAS AE.  When client’s are successfully enrolled for their OAS pension to automatically start receiving their benefit the month following their 65th birthdate the client is considered Eligible and Entitled for their OAS Pension and Eligible to GIS.  To fully calculate the income tested benefit we require the client’s Marital Status and their income if single, separated, divorced or widow and the combine income of couples married or in a common law relationship.

In order to get the most up to date and the proper income information required to calculate the GIS benefit at age 65, the CRA Income must be obtained at 64 + 9 months (3 months prior to OAS effective date).

Design Consideration: Before the CRA will send this information to the system, the request must be sent to CRA with a list of eligible client information for OAS Category 2 auto-enrolment. This request is a design consideration around ITRDS as to whether ITRDS will send the request on behalf of OAS and OAS will receive the response. This design must be considered in relation to the ITRDS interfaces (#7528).
Frequency
Monthly

Complexity


External Dependencies


Data

No data available from UC


Testing Details

Post events

  • the total number of clients who meet the criteria must be counted for monthly reporting purposes.  These are the total number of clients that will be considered for enrolment under both Category 1 or Category 2
  • Where client is excluded from GIS AE, he/she must receive an GIS Application (ISP3025)
  • Where client is included from GIS AE, he/she must receive an GIS Notification letter Application (ISP3018)
  • The non-GIS beneficiary spouse of the GIS AE client must receive an ISP3115
  • An OAS/GIS notice of entitlement (ISP3092) at age 65 where OAS enrolment status equals enrolled
  • If client were successfully automatically enrolled, client must be added to the GIS for life list
fields.Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
1. GIVEN that the timing of the schedule event has been met      

WHEN individual is succesfully enrolled for OAS benefit AND the system receives  from CRA  tax filing data for this individual 

THEN The system is able to store the information to determine whether the client will be Auto-enrolled for GIS benefit
fields.Custom.Assumptions:
• CRA has received the request to provide information to ESDC
  • All data elements are present and in the required format
  • The system is up and running and is not experiencing scheduled or unscheduled downtime
  • the Connectivity with CRA is up and running
  • Data is sent in a secure and encrypted process

fields.System.Title: 466-IE-01.3-01 Receive from CRA the OAS Recovery Tax Reassessment Information
fields.System.Description:
Description:
As the System, I want to receive deduction data from CRA weekly for all OAS clients so that I can be aware of amounts to be held-back.

Background

Process Description:
As a system, I want to receive OAS Recovery Tax data from CRA, so that I can update records where clients have been assessed/re-assessed and where clients have had a change to their recovery tax.

CRA sends ESDC a weekly file to identify domestic & foreign accounts subject to OAS Recovery Tax (aka OAS claw-back). The file from CRA also contains client accounts that have filed their tax returns so that their OAS benefits can be unsuspended.
The system must receive and record data on a weekly basis from CRA, where clients have been assessed/re-assessed and where the OAS Recovery Tax has changed.

Interface Pattern:
IP-03 

Frequency:
Weekly

Complexity:


Link to Requirement:
Requirement ID number that this user story was created from

External Dependencies:


Data:
File Layout of OAS Recovery Tax File from CRA -- see attachment

Record Matching from CRA File:
From the files received from CRA, the following is a table identifying the information that is used to match the CRA accounts against the system data. This matching of data is used by all three functions (weekly, monthly yearly). One of the identifiers must match, and then at least 3 out of the 4 fields must match in order to be identified as “matched”:
 

CRA Record

System Data to match to

Identifier – if the first digit of the RC-SIN-TTN is >0

Social Insurance Number (SIN) (prime)

Identifier – if the first digit of the RC-SIN-TTN field is zero and the next digit is >0

Temporary Taxation Number (TTN)

Identifier – OAS account number plus administering region code

OAS Account Number plus Source System Region Code

RC-HRDC-SURNAME-TAG

First five letters of client surname 

RC-BIRTH-YEAR

Year of Birth

RC-BIRTH-MONTH

Month of Birth

RC-SEX-CODE

Gender Code


Testing Details:
List specifics for testing to be completed
fields.Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
Preconditions: Period not during the CRA blackout period (February - March) or maintenance window
Triggers: When CRA sends the weekly file containing OAS Recovery Tax Reassessment Information
Frequency: Weekly

----------------------------------

1. Given that the timing of the scheduled event has been met,     
    When the OAS Recovery Tax File is received, 
    Then file will be stored in the infrastructure folder where Curam batch will pick up and store in Curam tables.

2. Given that the timing of the scheduled event has been met,
    When the OAS Recovery Tax File is not received from CRA within one week,
    Then the solution will follow the standard Interop error handling on interface availability during non-blackout periods.
fields.Custom.Assumptions:
• Data that is currently shared with CRA is correct
  • Before CRA will send this data, ESDC sends CRA a file containing a list of new In-Pay accounts during the month so that CRA can determine if there is an OAS Recovery Tax for the new clients (#7582)
  • Information is sent between systems via a secure and encrypted process.
  • The system will follow the same process for IA-OAS beneficiaries as OAS beneficiaries

Design Consideration:
  • Define duration after which error handling solution will begin after data has not been received
  • Should there be a notification if/when file received
  • Archiving and retention
fields.System.Tags: Information Exchange; OAS Specific; Pod 5 - Interfaces; reference
